Tucson notices the positive changes in Rodimus and gives a smile of satisfa=
ction.  Yet his expression changes, one of grave concern.

" Yes, we will n=
eed stronger defenses.  I don't think our fight with Magmatron is over by a=
ny means.  We won the battle this time by getting everyone to safety but, t=
here is yet the possibility of retaliation on the enemies part.  I guess yo=
u could call it guardian intuition. The old dragon must have had the same a=
ttribute.  Only now, have events escalated and I sense that the reason for =
that, is because of the dragon's passing.  He somewhat kept the land free o=
f harm, and not smaller creature dared to challenge him.  But with age, he =
weakened, and even Magmatron who's strength always outshone his own, realiz=
es that without the guardian, it's easy pickings.  Well, not anymore.  Now =
instead of one guardian there are many, and as guardians we need to step up=
 our protection. "

He looks ahead toward home.

" This planet needs a chan=
ce to evolve.  And if Nemesis Prime thinks he can destroy this world, I wil=
l not hesitate to show him that no one lays harm on innocent life forms wit=
hout paying a price for their actions.  I've been entrusted by the old drag=
on, to pick up where he left off, being sure NOTHING LAYS HARM TO THE PLANE=
T HE VOWS TO DEFEND. "

Tucson had also changed, he had realized why the dr=
agon had chosen him.  Perhaps it was to help guide Rodimus and the other Ma=
ximals but, his primary purpose being the all around Guardian Prime of the =
environment and the creatures that lived there.  Rodimus was ready now, he =
grew all the wiser and he felt that he could lead them to safety and beyond=
.  

" And with that said, I know my purpose now.  Rodimus, the Maximals ha=
ve their leader and I am flying next to him.  But this planet needs a guard=
ian and I have been chosen to take that position.  I will always help you w=
hen my help is needed, and I will help reinforce the defenses.  But when we=
 return I must take my rightful place, the cave that sits overlooking the A=
rk, that is where I must reside.  That is where he stood guard and that is =
where I must stand.   And when you hear my voice crack the sky like thunder=
, you will be alerted to danger before it strikes you."

Even though far aw=
ay, Tucson could now see the peak of the cave where he would stand guard an=
d follow the footsteps of the Silver Dragon of the past.

" We have a ways =
to go but, there ahead, we are approaching home."

Local artist who special=
izes in illustration, using traditional and digital media.  

I also specia=
lize in hand made crafts.  Great for any occasion!  

Need a great gift ide=
a that is original?  No problem!  Email me at this address and we will talk=
.  

On Apr 4, 2012, at 6:33 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> w=
rote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson follows Rodimus and to be sure he could be =
heard, he roars to his Maximal
> > comrades, in a tone of voice that clearl=
y signals them that he was still very much alive.
> > He then looks down to=
 Rodimus and gets beside him.
> >
> > " For once, I agree with you. We may =
not always see eye to eye but it doesn't mean I
> > don't respect who you a=
re. Now, our only hope to escape this threat is to relocate all
> > togethe=
r. We must return to the Ark and see if we can get it flying just enough to=
 relocate
> > its position. Before I became a warrior, I did extensive work=
 in mechanical and weaponry
> > restoration. I haven't lost sight of those =
skills. I can attempt to restore the essential
> > components for transport=
, and worry about the rest at a later time. Of course I will need a
> > bit=
 of help from anyone with engineering as their background, which I believe =
Stanton and
> > Bump, along with Legacy, could be a big help. All right, le=
t's guide them home!"
> >
> > He quickens his pace with a beat of his large=
 wings.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> RODIMUS nodded slightly as his large wings cupped t=
he air for a moment
> and then also flapped, propelling his large fiery for=
m through the
> air.
> 
> "I wish we could move the Ark." RODIMUS said afte=
r a moment, "But any
> changes that large could create severe problems in t=
he timeline." He
> said firmly. "But perhaps we can work on defenses."
> 
>=
 > <OLD>
> >
> > nighlight slowly moved and started to woke up, she felt so=
 weak. She vagely
> > heard familiar noises.
> 
> RODIMUS looked down to se=
e his wife NIGHTLIGHT cradled gently in his
> claws. He paused slightly as =
he shifted her to a position where she
> would be as comfortable as possibl=
e for the flight home.
> 
> "Come!" RODIMUS said in a deep voice as he and =
TUSCON flew over the
> other MAXIMALS. "It is time to go home!" His voice m=
ay not have been
> as loud as TUSCON's but it did carry enough to get the p=
oint across.
> 
> There was something different about RODIMUS, the differen=
ce being more
> than just his new mode. He seemed to now have a beast mode.=
 It was not
> that something was wrong, but that he had grown more than jus=
t in
> size, but somehting else seemed to be happening as well.
> 
> Wisdom=
 perhaps? Self confidence? Also, what other changes have
> occurred in the =
bot who once once a stubborn but charismatic Cavalier,
> then commander who=
 lacked confidence?
> 
> Time would tell . . .
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston

lways see eye to eye but it doesn't mean I<br>

re. Now, our only hope to escape this threat is to relocate all<br>
> to=
gether. We must return to the Ark and see if we can get it flying just enou=
gh to relocate<br>

nsive work in mechanical and weaponry<br>

onents for transport, and worry about the rest at a later time. Of course I=

ickens his pace with a beat of his large wings.<br>

r>
RODIMUS nodded slightly as his large wings cupped the air for a moment<b=
r>
and then also flapped, propelling his large fiery form through the<br>
a=
ir.<br>
<br>
"I wish we could move the Ark." RODIMUS said after a moment, "=
But any<br>
changes that large could create severe problems in the timeline=
." He<br>

RO=
DIMUS looked down to see his wife NIGHTLIGHT cradled gently in his<br>
claw=
s. He paused slightly as he shifted her to a position where she<br>
would b=
e as comfortable as possible for the flight home.<br>
<br>
"Come!" RODIMUS =
said in a deep voice as he and TUSCON flew over the<br>
other MAXIMALS. "It=
 is time to go home!" His voice may not have been<br>
as loud as TUSCON's b=
ut it did carry enough to get the point across.<br>
<br>
There was somethin=
g different about RODIMUS, the difference being more<br>
than just his new =
mode. He seemed to now have a beast mode. It was not<br>
that something was=
 wrong, but that he had grown more than just in<br>
size, but somehting els=
e seemed to be happening as well.<br>
<br>
Wisdom perhaps? Self confidence?=
 Also, what other changes have<br>
occurred in the bot who once once a stub=
born but charismatic Cavalier,<br>
then commander who lacked confidence?<br=
>
<br>
Time would tell . . .<br>
